properties.name: French Polynesia
properties.description: Posted by CalestewartFrench PolynesiaPolynesia is generally defined as the islands within the Polynesian triangle. The term "Polynesia", meaning many islands, was first used by Charles de Brosses in 1756, and originally applied to all the islands of the Pacific. Until1831. Geographically, and simply, Polynesia may be described as a triangle with its corners at Hawaii, New Zealand and Easter Island. The other main island groups located within the Polynesian triangle are Samoa, Tonga, the many island chains that form the Cook Islands and French Polynesia.

properties.name: Grand Canyon, AZ
properties.description: Posted by CalestewartGrand Canyon, AZ 86023The Grand Canyon is a steep-sided gorge carved by the Colorado River in the U.S. state of Arizona. It is largely contained within the Grand Canyon National Park — one of the first national parks in the United States. President Theodore Roosevelt was a major proponent of preservation of the Grand Canyon area, and visited on numerous occasions to hunt and enjoy the scenery. The long lasting scientific agreement has been that the canyon was created by the Colorado River over a period of six million years, but research released in 2008 suggests a much longer 17 million year[1] time span.

properties.name: Honnalulu, Hawaii
properties.description: Posted by Calestewart1941 Poipu Rd.Honolulu is the capital and most populous census-designated place (CDP) in the U.S. state of Hawaii. Although Honolulu refers to the city itself along the south shore of the island, it is commonly designated as the entire island of Oahu. In the Hawaiian language, Honolulu means "sheltered bay" or "place of shelter." It lies along the southeast coast of the island of Oahu and of the City & County of Honolulu. The population was 371,657 at the 2000 census. Honolulu is the only incorporated city in Hawaii; all other local government entities in Hawaii are administered at the county level. The island of Oahu (approximately 600 square miles) is under the administrative jurisdiction of the consolidated City of Honolulu.

properties.name: London, England
properties.description: Posted by CalestewartLondon, England London is the largest urban area and capital of England and the United Kingdom. At its core, the ancient City of London, to which the name historically belongs, still retains its limited mediaeval boundaries; but since at least the 19th century the name "London" has also referred to the whole metropolis which has developed around it. Today the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region of England and the Greater London administrative area, with its own elected mayor and assembly.

properties.name: Paris, France
properties.description: Posted by CalestewartParisis the capital city of France. It is situated on the Seine river, in northern France, at the heart of the Île-de-France region (aka "Paris Region", or in French: Region Parisian). The City of Paris has an estimated population of 2,167,994 within its city limits (January 2006). The Paris unité urbane (or urban area) extends well beyond the city limits and has an estimated population of 9.93 million (in 2005), while the Paris (or metropolitan area) has a population of nearly 12 million and is one of the most populated metropolitan areas in Europe.

properties.name: Roswell, New Mexico
properties.description: Posted by CalestewartRoswell, New Mexico 88201Roswell is a city in Chaves County in the southeastern quarter of the state of New Mexico, USA. It is the county seat of Chaves County. As of the 2005 census estimate, the population was 45,199, making it New Mexico\'s fifth largest city. In the 1930s, Roswell was a site for much of Robert Goddard\'s early rocketry work. Roswell is most popularly known for having its name attached to what is now called the 1947 Roswell UFO incident, even though the actual crash site was about 75 miles from Roswell, and in fact closer to the town of Corona. However, the investigation and debris recovery was handled by the local Roswell Army Air Field.

properties.name: Sydeny Habour, Australia
properties.description: Posted by Calestewart30 Pitt St Sydney, New South Wales 2000 Australiais the most populous city in Australia, with a metropolitan area population of approximately 4.28 million (2006 estimate).[1] It is the state capital of New South Wales, and the site of the first European colony in Australia, established in 1788 at Sydney Cove by Arthur Phillip, leader of the First Fleet from Britain.[2] A resident of the city is referred to as a Sydneysider. Sydney is located on Australia\'s south-east coast. The city is built around Port Jackson, which includes Sydney Harbor, leading to the city\'s nickname, "the Harbor City". It is noted for the Harbor Bridge, and its beaches. The metropolitan area is surrounded by national parks, and contains many bays, rivers and inlets.

properties.name: The National Civil Rights Museum
properties.description: Posted by Calestewart  450 Mulberry Street Memphis, TN 38103The aftershock of the shooting of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. on April 4, 1968 would plunge the Lorraine Motel, a small minority-owned business in the south-end of downtown Memphis, into a long and steep decline. The motel’s owner, Walter Lane Bailey kept a couple of rooms as a shrine to Dr. King and to Bailey’s wife, Lorraine, who died of a brain hemorrhage several hours after King was shot. By 1982, the Lorraine Motel was a foreclosed property. A group of prominent Memphians, concerned that this historic site would be destroyed through continued neglect and indifference, formed the Martin Luther King Memorial Foundation to save the Lorraine. Using a design report by a former Smithsonian Institution, Benjamin Lawless, and the Foundation started seeking funding for the nations’ first comprehensive exhibit chronicling America’s civil rights movement.

properties.name: Washington, DC
properties.description: Posted by CalestewartWashington, District of ColumbiaWashington is the capital of the United States. It has the same boundaries as the District of Columbia (or "D.C."). The city and the district are located on the banks of the Potomac River and bordered by Virginia to the southwest and Maryland to the northwest, northeast and southeast. The city was named after George Washington, the first president of the United States. The city is commonly referred to as Washington, The District, or simply D.C.

properties.name: prince edward island
properties.description: Posted by Calestewart6 Prince St., CharlottetownPrince Edward Island is a Canadian province. The maritime province is the smallest in the nation in both land area and population (excluding the territories). The Island has a few other names such as: "Garden of the Gulf" referring to the pastoral scenery and lush agricultural lands throughout the province; and "Birthplace of Confederation", referring to the Charlottetown Conference in 1864. Among some Islanders, it is also colloquially referred to as "Potholes Every Inch", a joking reference to the Island\'s sub-par road conditions in some locations. Another long-standing nickname, "Million Acre Farm", is no longer accurate now that only half of the Island\'s 1,398,000 acres are cultivated.
